title: Ranked Ladder Reset?
body:
The new season just started, and the ranked ladder has been reset. However, when I try to queue with a friend of mine it says that the gap in rank between the two of us is too large. 

I can deal with the fact that I need to improve to be able to play at the same level as him in ranked, but I figured at the very least with the new season starting I could try to play with him for a little bit and see if we're able to get ranked close enough together.

It just doesn't make sense to me that, with the new season having started and the ladder being reset, I would still get a message stating that our ranks are too far apart, when we're unranked.

For reference, he was Plat 5, while I was Silver 3

replies.body: Does the affect both Solo/Duo and Flex queues? Can you [**grab a screenshot**](https://gyazo.com/) of the specific message and let me take a look into this?

It only seems to affect Solo/Duo queue; however, our Flex ranks weren't as far apart due to only being from the Pre-season, so the issue of being ranked apart wasn't an issue prior to the season change either.

Here's a screenshot of the message: [Link](https://gyazo.com/d9e086fe93cb783a268ce219069f93d5)

I'd be inclined to agree with *Lew*, as there was data pulled from last season and the preseason that works along with tier restrictions. It seems what you're seeing is correct, there is a gap in your MMRs and previous tier rankings that will [prevent you from queueing together](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h4).

I hope this helped, please let me know if you have any other questions.

Even though there was a reset with the new season, it still takes into account your last season's ranked when you do placements so the same [tier ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h4)restrictions are still in place.
